results.title: Royal tour of Queen Elizabeth II
results.brief_description: In 1954, huge crowds greeted Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Philip on her Australian tour, all captured by newsreel camera crews who followed the royals around Australia. Footage was also made into the first Australian colour documentary, The Queen in Australia.

constellations_primary.name: Royalty, royalty, royalty
constellations_primary.description: Fascination with the royal family has persisted over the years, as seen through newsreels, documentaries, films, TV shows, tabloid news and satire.

constellations_other.name: Spectacle
constellations_other.description: The moving image has captured some of history’s biggest moments. From newsreel shorts in cinemas before the show to the arrival of TV, nightly news and the 24-hour news cycle to social media, news has become a spectacle.

results.description: In 1954, Queen Elizabeth II was the first reigning monarch to visit Australia. Huge crowds greeted the Queen and Prince Philip, all captured by newsreel camera crews who followed the royals around Australia. Footage from the tour was also made into the first Australian colour documentary, The Queen in Australia.
description_for_label: In 1954, Queen Elizabeth II was the first reigning monarch to visit Australia. Huge crowds greeted the Queen and Prince Philip, all captured by newsreel camera crews who followed the royals around Australia. Footage from the tour was also made into the first Australian colour documentary, The Queen in Australia.

results.title: Royal Stirling
results.creator_credit: Mark Littlewood, Campbell Harper and Films of Scotland
results.brief_description: The town of Stirling is at the centre of Scotland’s history, as those battles which determined her independence were fought within sight of Stirling Castle. Historical landmarks contrast with the newly founded University which has brought a sense of new life to the area.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Littlewood, Campbell Harper and Films of Scotland

results.title: Royal spring wedding
results.brief_description: The wedding of HRH Princess Alexandra and the Hon. Angus Ogilvy at Westminster Abbey in April 1963. Joins the waiting crowds to pick out some of the famous guests arriving, until the moment when the presence of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth indicates that the bride is on her way. A fanfare greets the arrival of Princess Alexandra, who walks (with her chief bridesmaid, HRH Princess Anne, in attendance) to join her groom at the altar, and the majestic service proceeds. The Princess and her husband leave the Abbey to drive in the famous glass coach to St James Palace.

results.title: Royal Scotland
results.brief_description: The last film made by the Crown Film Unit. The scenic beauty of Scotland and its many royal and historic associations. The film shows the Royal Family at Balmoral and at the Highland Games at Braemar and includes glimpses of ancient castles and abbeys, of golf at St Andrews and of massed pipers in Princes Street, Edinburgh.

results.title: Royal river [Abridged version]
results.creator_credit: Roger Blais, Gordon Sparling, Grant McLean and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The picturesque St. Lawrence, Canada’s river of history, welcomes Queen Elizabeth II to the opening of the St. Lawrence Seaway. Many close-ups of the Queen, Prince Philip and President Eisenhower are shown. The theme of the film is the river’s history, from its discovery by French explorers to its opening to the shipping of the world. This is an abridged version.

results.title: Royal review 1962
results.brief_description: Covers many colorful occasions in the Royal calendar for 1962, including the Trooping the Color Ceremony, the 16th Royal Film Performance, Independence celebrations in Jamaica, Trinidad and Uganda, the Chelsea Flower Show, the opening of the new Commonwealth Institute in London and HRH the Duke of Edinburgh’s tour of South America.
